item.title: Get to Know a New Side of Tempranillo
item.description:
Get to Know a New Side of Tempranillo

Tempranillo is Spain's second most planted grape, after the the lesser-known airén, and it is the country's signature varietal wine-one that's a crowd-pleaser, yet also age-worthy and collectable. According to Australian economics professor Kym Anderson, global Tempranillo plantings have boomed, increasing almost fivefold between 1990 and 2010, bringing tempranillo from the world's 24th most planted grape to the fourth.

item.title: Bacon Bacon's SoMa cafe, located near the ballpark, opens next week
item.description:
Bacon Bacon's SoMa cafe, located near the ballpark, opens next week

Attention bacon lovers: Just in time for the start of baseball season, Bacon Bacon's Third Street cafe is set to open this coming Monday, February 29. The tiny ten seat cafe, which is located just steps from the ballpark, marks the second brick-and-mortar spot for Jim Angelus's fleet of super popular bacon-fueled food trucks.

item.title: Gott's Roadside opening in Walnut Creek
item.description:
Gott's Roadside opening in Walnut Creek

Gott's Roadside Diner is opening its first East Bay location in downtown Walnut Creek. The wildly popular restaurant is known for its updated take on classic Americana roadside fare, including burgers made with natural Niman Ranch meat, sweet potato fries, and organic ice cream shakes, as well as ahi fish tacos, salads, craft beer, and robust selection of Napa Valley wines-the original restaurant opened in St.

item.title: Khachapuri Is The Best Drunk Food You've Never Heard Of
item.description:
Khachapuri Is The Best Drunk Food You've Never Heard Of

In the nation of Georgia, one dish is such a staple of the cuisine that its price is used to track inflation from region to region. It's called khachapuri, and it is an eggy, cheesy, bready miracle. To learn more about the dish, the Eater team visited Oda House, a traditional Georgian restaurant in New York's East Village.

item.title: No title
2012 Castello di Uzzano Chianti Classico
item.description:
2012 Castello di Uzzano Chianti Classico

I always enjoy buying Chianti Classicos at Costco because the prices are hard to beat, they are typically in the $13-19 range and the wines usually taste great. This is a DOCG bottle that I found for $13.99.

item.title: Jean-Charles Boisset Brings His Inimitable Style to Yountville
item.description:
Jean-Charles Boisset Brings His Inimitable Style to Yountville

Yountville, known as the Napa Valley's culinary capital, already boasted some of the best restaurant in the region. Now, it also has the hautest new spot, make that spots, with flamboyant Frenchman Jean-Charles Boisset's new JCB Tasting Salon, a wine tasting and luxury lifestyle retail destination, and Atelier by JCB, a gourmet épicerie that offers a curated assortment of gourmet culinary delights.
